name: ListPrincipalRateLimitEntities
description:
Retrieve all Principal Rate Limit entities.

This tool lists all Principal Rate Limit entities considering the provided parameters, helping to manage and monitor rate limits effectively.

parameters.name: principal_type_filter
parameters.description: Filters the list by principal type, e.g., `SSWS_TOKEN` or `OAUTH_CLIENT`.

value_schema.description:
Filters the list of principal rate limit entities by the provided principal type (`principalType`). For example,
`filter=principalType eq "SSWS_TOKEN"` or `filter=principalType eq "OAUTH_CLIENT"`.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: The cursor for pagination, an opaque string specifying current location in the list, obtained from the `Link` response header.

value_schema.description: The cursor to use for pagination. It's an opaque string that specifies your current location in the list and is obtained from the `Link` response header. See [Pagination](https://developer.okta.com/docs/api/#pagination).

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items to return in a single response page.

value_schema.description: Specifies the number of items to return in a single response page.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the okta API.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Filters the list of principal rate limit entities by the provided principal type (`principalType`). For example,
`filter=principalType eq "SSWS_TOKEN"` or `filter=principalType eq "OAUTH_CLIENT"`.

value_schema.description:
Filters the list of principal rate limit entities by the provided principal type (`principalType`). For example,
`filter=principalType eq "SSWS_TOKEN"` or `filter=principalType eq "OAUTH_CLIENT"`.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor to use for pagination. It's an opaque string that specifies your current location in the list and is obtained from the `Link` response header. See [Pagination](https://developer.okta.com/docs/api/#pagination).

value_schema.description: The cursor to use for pagination. It's an opaque string that specifies your current location in the list and is obtained from the `Link` response header. See [Pagination](https://developer.okta.com/docs/api/#pagination).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Specifies the number of items to return in a single response page.

value_schema.description: Specifies the number of items to return in a single response page.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
